meanings.definition: An area of land used for raising livestock or growing crops.
meanings.sent1: The ranchlands were vast and filled with cows and corn.
meanings.sent2: The farmers worked hard on the ranchlands to grow their crops.
meanings.sent3: The ranchlands were so fertile that even the rocks seemed to sprout vegetables!
meanings.sent4: The ranchlands stretched out like a patchwork quilt of green and gold.
meanings.sent5: The sun set over the ranchlands, painting the sky in hues of orange and pink.

meanings.definition: The land surrounding a ranch, typically used for agricultural purposes.
meanings.sent1: The ranchlands extended as far as the eye could see, surrounding the homestead.
meanings.sent2: The cattle grazed peacefully on the ranchlands under the watchful eye of the rancher.
meanings.sent3: The ranchlands were so vast that the rancher had to use a telescope to see the other side!
meanings.sent4: The ranchlands whispered secrets of the past to those who cared to listen.
meanings.sent5: The scent of fresh hay filled the air on the ranchlands, a comforting aroma for the hardworking farmers.
